intro: Dyschoriste greenmanii, commonly known as the greenman's dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
